===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|じゅろうじん}}

# {{lb|ja|Shinto|sort=じゅろうじん}} The Japanese [[god]] of [[longevity]]. One of the seven gods of [[luck]].

====Related terms====
* {{l|ja|福禄寿}} ([[Fukurokuju]]): god of happiness, wealth and longevity.
* {{l|ja|恵比須}} / {{l|ja|恵比寿}} / {{l|ja|夷}} / {{l|ja|戎}} ([[Ebisu]]): god of fishers or merchants, often depicted carrying a sea bream.
* {{l|ja|布袋}} ([[Hotei]]): the fat and happy god of abundance and good health.
* {{l|ja|弁才天}} / {{l|ja|弁財天}} ({{l|ja|べんざいてん}}, ''[[Benzaiten]]''): The Japanese [[name]] for the [[Hindu]] [[goddess]] [[Saraswati]]. The goddess of [[knowledge]], [[art]], [[beauty]], [[music]], [[language]], [[wisdom]], [[poetry]] and [[rivers]].
* {{l|ja|大黒}} / {{l|ja|大黒天}} ([[Daikoku]] / [[Daikokuten]]): the god of wealth, commerce and trade. Ebisu and Daikoku are often paired and represented as carvings or masks on the walls of small retail shops.
* {{l|ja|毘沙門}} / {{l|ja|毘沙門天}} ([[Bishamon]] / [[Bishamonten]]): the god of warriors.
